Package net.emuman.spigotutils.gui

Class PartialDynamicSidebar

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable
      • net.emuman.spigotutils.gui.PartialDynamicSidebar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullDynamicSidebar
    public class PartialDynamicSidebar
extends org.bukkit.scheduler.BukkitRunnable
    A sidebar that can be dynamically set and updated. The difference between this class and the FullDynamicSidebar is that only the first and last 16 characters in any given line can be updated. However, this comes with the advantage that less than 15 lines may be present, so use this class instead when possible.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PartialDynamicSidebar

        public PartialDynamicSidebar​(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String title,
                             org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard board)
        Creates a new PartialDynamicSidebar.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID for the sidebar (must be 16 characters or less).
        title - the display name for the sidebar, appearing at the top.
        board - the scoreboard to assign the sidebar to.

      • PartialDynamicSidebar

        public PartialDynamicSidebar​(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String title)
        Creates a new PartialDynamicSidebar, using a newly created scoreboard.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique ID for the sidebar (must be 16 characters or less).
        title - the display name for the sidebar, appearing at the top.

    • Method Detail

      • addLine

        public void addLine​(java.lang.String body)
        Adds a new line to the dynamic sidebar.
        Parameters:
        body - the body content of the line (must be 16 characters or under in length).

      • setLinePrefix

        public void setLinePrefix​(int line,
                          java.lang.String text)
        Sets the first 16 characters of a line to the provided static text.
        Parameters:
        line - the index of the line to set (must be between 0 and 14, both inclusive).
        text - the text to populate the prefix of the line.

      • setLinePrefix

        public void setLinePrefix​(int line,
                          java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> updater)
        Sets the first 16 characters of a line to the provided dynamic updater.
        Parameters:
        line - the index of the line to set (must be between 0 and 14, both inclusive).
        updater - the supplier that provides the line prefix with content.

      • setLineSuffix

        public void setLineSuffix​(int line,
                          java.lang.String text)
        Sets the last 16 characters of a line to the provided static text.
        Parameters:
        line - the index of the line to set (must be between 0 and 14, both inclusive).
        text - the text to populate the suffix of the line.

      • setLineSuffix

        public void setLineSuffix​(int line,
                          java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> updater)
        Sets the last 16 characters of a line to the provided dynamic updater.
        Parameters:
        line - the index of the line to set (must be between 0 and 14, both inclusive).
        updater - the supplier that provides the line suffix with content.

      • removeUpdaters

        public void removeUpdaters​(int line)
        Removes all of the updaters for the given line, allowing new static strings to take precedence.
        Parameters:
        line - the line for which to remove the dynamic updaters.

      • blankFullLine

        public void blankFullLine​(int line)
        Blanks the prefix and suffix of the given line. Does not modify the line body (use FullDynamicSidebar for that functionality).
        Parameters:
        line - the line that should be blanked out.

      • blankLinePrefix

        public void blankLinePrefix​(int line)
        Blanks the prefix of the given line.
        Parameters:
        line - the line that should be blanked out.

      • blankLineSuffix

        public void blankLineSuffix​(int line)
        Blanks the suffix of the given line.
        Parameters:
        line - the line that should be blanked out.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)
        Parameters:
        title - the new title of the scoreboard.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle​(java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> updater)
        Parameters:
        updater - the String supplier for the title of the scoreboard.

      • removeTitleUpdater

        public void removeTitleUpdater()
        Removes the updater for the title, allowing new static strings to take precedence.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        the title of the scoreboard.

      • getBoard

        public org.bukkit.scoreboard.Scoreboard getBoard()
        Returns:
        the scoreboard object of the sidebar, to be passed into Player#setScoreboard.

      • getObjective

        public org.bukkit.scoreboard.Objective getObjective()
        Returns:
        the objective that this scoreboard uses for the sidebar (generally does not need to be called).

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        the number of lines in the scoreboard.

      • run

        public void run()
        Updates all of the lines using the provided updaters. Should generally only be called by Bukkit. Use methods extended from BukkitRunnable to run this class.
